tweets.html:
If @ChristaBMiller doesn't break your heart a little in this week's #CougarTown, I'm not sure we can be friends.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 15, 2012

"anyone hear about this new ipad?" [jay leno pauses] "anyone hear anything at all?" [jay wanders the desolate cities. even the wind is gone]

— bandit (@UtilityLimb) April 17, 2012

Saddest thing about Tupac playing Coachella by hologram: nobody even noticed when Elvis appeared by fax.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 17, 2012

You know you're middle-aged when the only characters you relate to on "Girls" are Peter Scolari and Becky Ann Baker.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) April 17, 2012

Morning-show ratings wars are the new latenight-show ratings wars. #twitterthinkpiece

— Adam Sternbergh (@sternbergh) April 17, 2012

"I can't believe they didn't touch on the free trade Autopact between Canada/U.S." - Things nobody's ever said about season 4 of #MadMen

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) April 17, 2012

New #CougarTown tonight. If you don't watch, you need to hand over your wine to those that do. It's only fair.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 17, 2012

New show pitch: "War Wars." Despots gather around abandoned weapon lockers and bid on them.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 17, 2012

"The New Yorker" needs to do a long profile of Brenda Hampton like yesterday.

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 17, 2012

My phone auto-corrects "thank" to "Thanos" now, meaning I've hit the point where I reference Marvel villains more than I thank people.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) April 17, 2012

Going to try out this show called COUGAR TOWN at 8:30. Heard it's funnyish...

— Bill Lawrence (@VDOOZER) April 17, 2012

My son just told me his favorite show is #NCIS. CBS's median demographic just plummeted to 43.

— Julie Hammerle🔨 (@JulieHammerle) April 18, 2012

I love how America still occasionally trots out Trista and Ryan. They are, after all, the only surviving Tributes in Bachelor history.

— Allie Hagan (@alliehagan) April 18, 2012

#NewGirl is the best comedy on television right now, and it will remain so for the next 48 hours and 22 minutes. #ParksAndRec

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) April 18, 2012

Great. So now my insurance company tells me it WON'T cover "GIRLS Backlash."

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) April 18, 2012

I really don't think backlash is the right word, folks. It's that more than a couple of hundred of people finally saw it and are responding.

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) April 18, 2012

@noelrk I think the fact that you can tweet that without the word "Girls," and fully expect to be understood, indicates we need to move on.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 18, 2012

tweets.author_name: rich (who is, in many ways, poor)
tweets.html:
whatever you believe to be true or not true, real or not real, right or not right, you will see it or not see it in #hbogirls, apparently.

— rich (who is, in many ways, poor) (@p00rrichard) April 18, 2012

Like Patty Hewes, I fight for justice. So where is my apartment like that?

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) April 18, 2012

Amused by how much of #Damages appears to have been edited with Instagram filters.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) April 18, 2012

Some days I wonder if Tupac is the only one among us who's *not* a hologram.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) April 18, 2012

Lea is currently doing a Mraz song for Glee, bet it's not one of his unsubtle sex songs. S1 Finn should've sung 'clockwatching'.

— Hannah Ellison (@hanellison) April 17, 2012

"They should change their name to the No Directions!" Leave the snark to the professionals, #Glee.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

#SadWillSchuesterCurrentDayScene

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) April 18, 2012

THERE'S SO MUCH META IN MY #GLEE YOU GUYS.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

Does this school have any security? students from other schools, blaine's brother...anyone can just walk around! #Glee

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) April 18, 2012

It's amazing that Ryan Murphy gave the Glee Project kids THE EXACT characters he came up with in 4 minutes on that show.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) April 18, 2012

@corybarker Now now, Cory - that was edited. He probably talked for SEVEN minutes.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) April 18, 2012

Remember when Coach Beiste was on this show? #Glee

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

Guys, lock your doors: Will's giving advice to people about how to live their lives. #Glee

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

Well, now we know who should play Wonder Woman, right? #Glee

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

Jesus, is this what a good episode of #Glee looks like? It's been so long, I don't remember.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 18, 2012

There is never any need for falsetto Finn. Never. #glee

— Hannah Ellison (@hanellison) April 18, 2012

Am convinced Ryan Murphy created Darren Criss 'Weird Science'-style #Glee

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) April 18, 2012

PEOPLE! WE BROKE UP WITH #GLEE! STOP TRYING TO GET US BACK TOGETHER! #GLEE STOLE ALL OUR MONEY AND BURNED DOWN OUR HOUSE! NOT GONNA HAPPEN!

— Tom & Lorenzo (@tomandlorenzo) April 18, 2012

Having to watch Glee now gives me that pit of my stomach feeling I haven't had since, like, high school physics.

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) April 18, 2012

Dear Finn: There's this thing called an Undecided Major. #Glee

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) April 18, 2012

I bet if Santana wanted to, she could move to NY right now and get a solid ensemble role in "Heaven on Earth." #Glee #Smash

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) April 18, 2012

Gene Siskel is rolling over in his grave. #Glee

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) April 18, 2012

Every single #Glee senior wants to be famous. Can't someone aspire to be an engineer or English teacher or something? Like normal people.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) April 18, 2012

There is not a single character on #Glee that I still like.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) April 18, 2012

Glee: Inspired silliness, grounded emotion & a touch of afterschool special. That's all I ever wanted. That and Sam ripping his shirt open.

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) April 18, 2012

Watching Biggest Loser. Bob Harper is a terrible actor.

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) April 18, 2012

People should fear teatime at the Grayson house. #Revenge

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) April 18, 2012

Tonight's "Ringer" finale is putting the "Zzzzz..." in "ZOMG."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 18, 2012

I hope we learn in tonight's #Ringer finale that this first season was all a bad dream Anya has been having. #BTVS

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 17, 2012

@TVMcGee Wouldn't there be more bunnies in that case?

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) April 17, 2012

I can't bring myself to write about the "Ringer" finale because I don't have the patience to get yelled at by 3 or 4 "Ringer" fans.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) April 18, 2012

OMG just found out Titanic is a real movie?!? I thought it was just a subject for crappy YouTube parodies!

— Ken Jennings (@KenJennings) April 18, 2012

Resisted (strong) temptation to chant "Donna Martin Graduate" as Tori Spelling strutted through our courtyard earlier. (Cc @snoodit)

— Lacey Rose (@LaceyVRose) April 18, 2012

If it weren't for all the fascism and ethnic cleansing, the Children of Men universe would be the closest thing to an ideal scenario for me.

— Recognize the Vox Union Now (@alex_navarro) April 18, 2012

Has anyone else noticed #NewGirl is great at the tone at which HIMYM is terrible? #grammaticallycorrectweet

— Byron Hauck (@byronhauck) April 18, 2012

The Voice, where there's plenty of time for a Bieber victory lap and not enough for the actual show.

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) April 18, 2012

Have to say, these "Charlie Sheen died... and went to FX" ads for AngerManagement are 1 part creepy, 2 parts genius.

— Lacey Rose (@LaceyVRose) April 18, 2012

Being baffled by Tosh.0 is the first sign for a child of the 1980s that you're growing old.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 18, 2012

@sarCCastro I know nothing about Tiny Furniture except that I see it and think it's a show about Lester Freamon's tiny furniture business.

@stayfrostymw @sarCCastro Lester Freamon: The Pawn Shop Years.

— Christopher Dole (@chrisdole86) April 18, 2012
